grounding: Diagnostic classification tests are designed to assess examinees’ discrete mastery status on a set of skills or attributes. Such tests have gained increasing attention in educational and psychological measurement. We review diagnostic classification models and their applications to testing and learning, discuss their statistical and machine learning connections and related challenges, and introduce some contemporary and future extensions.
generated_text: This study explores statistical applications in cognitive diagnostic testing, focusing on diagnostic classification and educational measurement. It examines psychometric methods, including latent class analysis, and their integration with adaptive learning systems. The research investigates statistical learning techniques, encompassing both supervised and unsupervised approaches, to enhance classification and clustering in cognitive assessment. Implications for improving educational measurement and personalized learning are discussed.
